intro: Centaurium anatolicum, commonly known as Anatolian centaury, is a flowering plant native to Turkey and parts of the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in loose clusters at the top of the stem. Centaurium anatolicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
